goals.question: What is the distribution of population in London?
goals.rationale: This visualization will help us understand the spread of population across London and identify any areas with high or low population density.

goals.question: What is the average age of the population in London?
goals.rationale: A box plot will help us identify the median, quartiles and outliers in the age distribution of the population in London.

goals.question: What is the distribution of crime rates across London boroughs?
goals.rationale: A choropleth map will help us visualize the spatial distribution of crime rates across London boroughs and identify any areas with high or low crime rates.

goals.question: What is the relationship between average income and house prices in London?
goals.visualization: Scatter plot of average income and house prices
goals.rationale: A scatter plot will help us identify any correlation between average income and house prices in London and identify any areas with high or low house prices relative to income levels.

goals.question: What is the distribution of air pollution levels across London boroughs?
goals.visualization: Heat map of air pollution levels
goals.rationale: A heat map will help us visualize the spatial distribution of air pollution levels across London boroughs and identify any areas with high or low pollution levels.

code:
import seaborn as sns
import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    sns.histplot(data=data, x='population', bins=20, kde=True, color='blue')
    plt.title('What is the distribution of population in London?', wrap=True)
    plt.xlabel('Population')
    plt.ylabel('Frequency')
    plt.legend(['Population Distribution'])
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)

import seaborn as sns
import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    sns.boxplot(x='age', data=data)
    plt.axvline(data['age'].mean(), color='red', linestyle='--', label=f"Average Age: {data['age'].mean():.2f}")
    plt.legend()
    plt.title("What is the average age of the population in London?", wrap=True)
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)

import seaborn as sns
import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import geopandas as gpd
import json

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    # Load London boroughs geojson file
    with open('londonCentroids.json', 'r') as file:
        london_boroughs = json.load(file)

    # Convert to geopandas dataframe
    gdf = gpd.GeoDataFrame.from_features(london_boroughs['features'])

    # Merge data with geopandas dataframe
    gdf = gdf.merge(data, left_on='name', right_on='borough')

    # Plot choropleth map
    fig, ax = plt.subplots(1, figsize=(10, 6))
    gdf.plot(column='crime_rate', cmap='coolwarm', linewidth=0.8, ax=ax, edgecolor='0.8', legend=True)

    # Set title
    plt.title('What is the distribution of crime rates across London boroughs?', wrap=True)

    return plt;

chart = plot(data)

import seaborn as sns
import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    sns.scatterplot(data=data, x='average_income', y='house_prices', hue='borough')
    plt.title('What is the relationship between average income and house prices in London?', wrap=True)
    plt.xlabel('Average Income')
    plt.ylabel('House Prices')
    plt.legend(title='Borough', loc='upper left', bbox_to_anchor=(1, 1))
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)

import seaborn as sns
import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import json
import geopandas as gpd
from mpl_toolkits.axes_grid1 import make_axes_locatable

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    # Load London boroughs centroids data
    with open('londonCentroids.json', 'r') as file:
        london_centroids = json.load(file)

    # Convert the data to a GeoDataFrame
    gdf = gpd.GeoDataFrame(data, geometry=gpd.points_from_xy(data['longitude'], data['latitude']))

    # Create a dictionary to map borough names to pollution levels
    borough_pollution = {centroid['borough']: centroid['pollution_level'] for centroid in london_centroids}

    # Add a new column to the GeoDataFrame with pollution levels
    gdf['pollution_level'] = gdf['borough'].map(borough_pollution)

    # Create the figure and axis
    fig, ax = plt.subplots(1, 1, figsize=(10, 10))

    # Plot the heat map
    divider = make_axes_locatable(ax)
    cax = divider.append_axes("right", size="5%", pad=0.1)
    sns.heatmap(gdf.pivot_table(index='latitude', columns='longitude', values='pollution_level'), ax=ax, cbar_ax=cax)

    # Set the title
    plt.title('What is the distribution of air pollution levels across London boroughs?', wrap=True)

    return plt;

chart = plot(data)

import seaborn as sns
import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import json
import geopandas as gpd
from mpl_toolkits.axes_grid1 import make_axes_locatable

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    # Load London boroughs centroids data
    with open('londonCentroids.json', 'r') as file:
        london_centroids = json.load(file)

    # Convert the data to a GeoDataFrame
    gdf = gpd.GeoDataFrame(data, geometry=gpd.points_from_xy(data['longitude'], data['latitude']))

    # Create a dictionary to map borough names to pollution levels
    borough_pollution = {centroid['borough']: centroid['pollution_level'] for centroid in london_centroids}

    # Add a new column to the GeoDataFrame with pollution levels
    gdf['pollution_level'] = gdf['borough'].map(borough_pollution)

    # Create the figure and axis
    fig, ax = plt.subplots(1, 1, figsize=(10, 10))

    # Plot the heat map
    divider = make_axes_locatable(ax)
    cax = divider.append_axes("right", size="5%", pad=0.1)
    sns.heatmap(gdf.pivot_table(index='latitude', columns='longitude', values='pollution_level'), ax=ax, cbar_ax=cax)

    # Set the title
    plt.title('What is the distribution of air pollution levels across London boroughs?', wrap=True)

    return plt;

chart = plot(data)
